avalancheActivity.highlights: Older snow is generally stiff and stable. The little snow that has added the last week can become temporarily unstable when it warms up on Monday and then small avalanches are possible. New wind slabs might form high in mountains the next days.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Thaw Monday 26.2. affected the snowpack up to the mountain tops, and a significant amount of snow melted. The snowpack became uniform before stiffening and gaining strength in cold weather. A little snow has been added since then, and small wind slabs may have formed in depressions and gullies where snow has accumulated. On Monday, thaw with rain is expected again and then the new snow might become temporarily unstable before subsiding and gaining strength. High in mountains, snow should add and drift this week.

travelAdvisory.comment: Middle size slab avalanches due to warming in the east. Also in the north but there the snow is still drifting on mountain ridges. This activity is in rather thin wind slabs but some crowns are thicker. Also thin slabs in the Westfjords but no new activity recorded.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Middle size slab avalanches due to warming in the east. Also in the north but there the snow is still drifting on mountain ridges.

weatherForecast.highlights: Eftir kuldakafla á að hlýna á mánudag með einhverri úrkomu, rigningu á láglendi en snjókomu hátt til fjalla. Frostmarkshæð ætti að sveiflast í kringum 1000 m hæð. Svipað veður næstu daga, SA og A áttir.

avalancheActivity.comment: A slab avalanche released in Skálavík Sunday 3.3. Multiple small loose avalanches fell on a thin layer after sun exposure this weekend in Seljalandsdalur. Few wet slabs also fell in thawing weather on Monday the 26th of February.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Small wind slabs could be present in SW-aspects in the mountains and could grow on Monday in NE-snowfall.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack thawed on Monday as warming temperatures reached the mountains. NE snowfall has been falling a little bit this week and small wind slabs could have formed in SW aspects in the mountains. The old snowpack most likely got stronger after the thawing weather but 10-15 cm of new snow was added this week. Sun exposure effected these top layers on Saturday and small avalanches fell in Seljalandsdalur. Snowfall in eastern winds is expected for Monday.

travelAdvisory.comment: Middle size slab avalanches due to warming in the east. Also in the north but there the snow is still drifting on mountain ridges. This activity is in rather thin wind slabs but some crowns are thicker. Also thin slabs in the Westfjords but no new activity recorded.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Middle size slab avalanches due to warming in the east. Also in the north but there the snow is still drifting on mountain ridges.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hlýnar á mánudag í austlægum áttum með lítilsháttar snjókomu. Litlir éljabakkar og skúrir um þriðjudagskvöld en þurrt að mestu yfir daginn í hægum breytilegum áttum.

avalancheActivity.comment: Snowmobile triggered a slab avalanche in Tungudalur by Dalvík during the weekend in S-aspect. A small avalanche was triggered by human activity in a S-aspect on Illviðrishnjúkur 29.2. along with two other on Tuesday, sized between 2 and 2.5.. There was considerable avalanche activity in the region before last weekend and during the thaw on Monday. A slab avalanche was reported in Klaufabrekkuskarð, sized 2.5.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Dangerous avalanche conditions are in the region. Weakness is present in the new snow as it has widely drifted into S-facing aspects and formed wind slabs. Travelers should beware of steep slopes and exercise caution.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Unstable layers are widespread after the snow from this week has drifted into southern aspects. A high temperature gradient is within the snowpack after thaw on Monday, followed by cold weather. Weakness has been discovered in the snowpack that has developed facets in this weekends frost. Stability tests have shown sudden planar failure on this weakness with very light load at apr. 37 cm depth. This weakness could be deeper in some places. Minor warming comes with eastern slush and snowfall on Monday which could compromise stability even more.

travelAdvisory.comment: Middle size slab avalanches due to warming in the east. Also in the north but there the snow is still drifting on mountain ridges. This activity is in rather thin wind slabs but some crowns are thicker. Also thin slabs in the Westfjords but no new activity recorded.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Middle size slab avalanches due to warming in the east. Also in the north but there the snow is still drifting on mountain ridges.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snjókoma er væntanleg í Austlægum áttum til fjalla aðfaranótt mánudags. Þurrt að mestu á þriðjudag og miðvikudag. Það hýnar talsvert með Mánudeginum þar sem hiti gæti náð allt að 8 gráðum á láglendi.

avalancheActivity.comment: Opp piste skiers triggered three slab avalanches on March 2nd, both in Stafdalur and Oddsskarð. A skier triggered a slab avalanche in Stafdalur on Feb 25th.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Dangerous avalanche conditions are in the region. New snow that has fallen the last week bonds poorly with older snow which has been though thaw. After the snowfall on Sunday it should warm a bit with rain up to approx. 1000 m and then wet avalanches might fall in the lower parts of slopes.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Significant snow has been added the past week and drifted, first in northerly winds and then NE and E wind on Sunday. New wind slabs have formed and can be quite thick in gullies and other places where snow accumulates. Older snow has been though thaw, but some layering still seems to exist in the upper part. At the intersection between recent snow and older snow is a weakness, and on Saturday March 2nd, three skiers triggered avalanches on this weakness. On Sunday, March 3rd, considerable snow fell in NE and E wind and right after it is supposed to warm up with rain up to approximately 1000 meters, but snowfall higher up. Natural wet avalanches can occur in the lower parts of slopes.

travelAdvisory.comment: Middle size slab avalanches due to warming in the east. Also in the north but there the snow is still drifting on mountain ridges. This activity is in rather thin wind slabs but some crowns are thicker. Also thin slabs in the Westfjords but no new activity recorded.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Middle size slab avalanches due to warming in the east. Also in the north but there the snow is still drifting on mountain ridges.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hlýnar smám saman á sunnudag með NA og A áttum og snjókomu til fjalla. Aðfaranótt mánudags á hiti að fara yfir frostmark og byrja að rigna hátt upp í hlíðar. Hlýindi og einhver rigning í næstu viku.
